humanum_full_description_en:
" Sheep " is like a pair of curved horns on the head of a sheep. The original meaning is sheep. The ancients believed that " sheep " was an auspicious animal. Today, some ethnic minorities still retain the custom of wearing horns and silver ornaments during festivals or festive seasons, so the Chinese characters for " sheep " mostly carry the meaning of beauty, kindness and auspiciousness. There is no shortage of examples of " sheep " and " xiang " in ancient and modern poems, such as Qingzhishanguan Poem Collection by Le Jun in Qing Dynasty. Song Huayuan's Marriage Picture Paper in Zhaogou Longshuang Village": "Next to the goat wine, I wish a good man, and my father-in-law He Xiangnv. A day of rejoicing for a hundred years old, my concubine works hard by the spinner."

The meaning and pronunciation of " yang " and " xiang " are very close, so the inscriptions and the bamboo slips of the Warring States period " yang " can be read as " xiang ", meaning auspicious, Zhongshan Wang Fanghu: "to be a minister and ğ¢“‰ (anti) minister Its master, Mo Dayan is not a sheep (xiang)." "Shangbo Bamboo Book Five. Ji Gengzi Asks about Confucius" Jane 10: "A good type (punishment) will not be a sheep (xiang), and a good killing will cause chaos.

" Sheep " is also a very important radical of Chinese characters. "Said Wen": "Sheep, auspicious. From ğ¦«³, like the shape of the head, horns and feet. Confucius said: "The character of cow and sheep is lifted in form." Every sheep belongs to the sheep." Press " Sheep " to read through ancient times. For " xiang ", see " xiang ". Duan Yucai's "Shuowen Jiezi Annotation": "The "Kaogongji Annotation" says: "Sheep, goodness." According to the words of Zun, Yi, Yi, and Mei, they all follow the sheep."

Jia Jinwen is used as the original meaning, referring to sheep. "Collection" 738 is: "Today (ç‡) three sheep, two pigs, and three dogs." The whole sentence refers to the use of three sheep, two pigs, and three dogs as a sacrifice today. It is also used as the name of the person, "Collection" 15314: "The broom (women) sheep shows ten tuns", the woman named Sheep arranged ten pairs of scapulas. Teacher ã¨ğ£ª•: "Assault the Fu (captive) scholar and female sheep and cattle.

Bronze inscriptions are also used as a clan name, Yangzi Ge: "Yangzi Zhi (made) Ge." There is also the word "Yang Zi", used as a place name (He Linyi), Yang Zi Ge: "The relative of sheep horns (new) Qian (made) San Ge." "Zuo Zhuan. "Twenty-sixth Year of Xianggong": "Qiwuyu went to the Jin Dynasty with Linqiu, attacking the horns to take it." The land is in the northwest of Yuncheng, Shandong.

In addition, the character " yang " in Chinese silk script can be read as " detailed ", which means detailed. "Mawangdui Silk Book. Warring States Political Strategist Book. "Su Qin Xianshu Zhao Wangzhang" line 236: "The minister wished that the king would fight the king and the sheep (detailed), but Zhu (duly) thought about it." The full sentence means that the courtier I hope the monarch and his subordinates will think about mine in detail. Speak and consider it carefully.

" Sheep" is like a pair of curved horns on the head of a sheep. The original meaning is sheep. The ancients believed that " sheep" was an auspicious animal. Today, some ethnic minorities still retain the custom of wearing horns and silver ornaments during festivals or festive seasons, so the Chinese characters for " sheep" mostly carry the meaning of beauty, kindness and auspiciousness. There is no shortage of examples of " sheep" and " xiang" in ancient and modern poems, such as Qingzhishanguan Poem Collection by Le Jun in Qing Dynasty. Song Huayuan's Marriage Picture Paper in Zhaogou Longshuang Village": "Next to the goat wine, I wish a good man, and my father-in-law He Xiangnv.
